ej,leylj801,M,schrp901,Schreiber touched Magglio Ordonez $Magglio Ordonez stood in the batter's box to say something about the third strike, which he thought was inside; HP umpire Paul Schreiber placed his hand on Ordonez' back as he tried to get him to go back to the dugout; Tigers Manager Jim Leyland came out furious that the umpire had touched the player; after a heated argument, Leyland was ejected by Schrieber
ej,gardr001,M,nauep901,Arguing that pitch hit Cuddyer Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire ejected by HP umpire Paul Nauert for arguing that the second pitch to Michael Cuddyer hit him

ej,redmm001,P,ticht901,Call at HP ej,gardr001,M,ticht901,Call at HP $Jeff Bailey slid across the plate as catcher Mike Redmond swept a tag across; HP umpire Todd Tichenor called Bailey safe; Redmond jumped up and started yelling at Tichenor, who ejected the catcher; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire ran out and was also ejected while arguing the situation; the Twins other catcher, Joe Mauer, was serving as the DH, so he went into catch and the club lost use of the DH for the rest of the game

ej,varij001,P,ticht901,Balls and strikes ej,frant001,M,ticht901,Balls and strikes; after Varitek ejection $the fourth pitch to Brendan Harris was at or near the outside corner; catcher Jason Varitek held the ball after catching it and when HP umpire Todd Tichenor called the pitch a ball, pitcher Josh Beckett reacted on the mound; Varitek stood up and turned to Tichenor to complain but mostly to protect his pitcher; Varitek was ejected by Tichenor and Red Sox manager Terry Francona ran out to argue and was also ejected; therefore, in the seventh inning, both catchers and both managers were ejected by Tichenor

replay,8,mauej001,MIN,davig901,MIN03,O,N,I,,H $Joe Mauer's fly ball hit the top of the wall in LF and came back on the field; it was called in play; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire asked about it, the umpires talked and then crew chief Gerry Davis watched the replay and upheld the call

ej,wedge001,M,davib902,Balls and strikes (foul tip) $on the sixth pitch to Justin Morneau, HP umpire Bob Davidson called a foul tip and strikeout; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire asked Davidson about the pitch, since it appeared to hit the ground; Davidson looked at the ball and talked with 1B umpire Wally Bell then ruled a foul ball and brought Morneau back to the plate; Indians Manager Eric Wedge argued and was ejected by Davidson
